sub_title: Engineering Lead | Chief Technical Lead | Passionate about Softwares & Distributed Systems
summary:
Software Engineering Expert with over 11 years of experience and demonstrated history of working in the global Banking and Energy sectors. I am proficient in BigData Systems Design & Development, for both Streaming and Batch oriented landscapes. Using OpenSource Technologies to achieve business targets is what I believe in.
By interacting with various stakeholders & combining my unique Inter-Personal & Communication skills, I ensure seamless flow of ideas in a team, with due focus on implementation: from business to technical requirements and vice versa.

projects.title: MIG- Model Instance Generator
projects.description: MIG, or Model Instance Generator, was a project developed in Python with the intention of providing a user the ability to dynamically aggregate granular sets of data, based on infinite number of selections, to perform some business processing and view the results thereafter.  This project is currently ongoing and involves development on Python2.7. I used XLWings to read user selections from  MS Excel, pre-process the data using DataFrames and ultimately store the result in either HDF Stores, SQLite Databases or MS Excel, depending upon user selections again. Data Pre-processing and analysis is done using formulae designed in advanced mathematical libraries such as NumPy and Scikit.

contributors.headline: Engineering Lead | Chief Technical Lead | Passionate about Softwares & Distributed Systems

projects.title: LastMileAnalytics.guru on Amazon Redshift
projects.description:
This project was aimed at solving the challenge of using Amazon Redshift as an Online Transactional Processing (OLTP) Service. 
Data processing was performed through Bash Scripts, supplemented by Amazon S3 Buckets. The ETL Process was automated thereafter using CRON Jobs on the Amazon EC2 instance. SQL Scripts, and the logic contained therein, was created using extreme caution to maintain to integrity data on the Redshift database. Several Python User Defined Functions(UDFs) were also created for data representation in the required formats. 
Transferring petabytes of data daily, without creating any data tunnel, was a noteworthy achievement in this project. Swaks and the email notifications associated with it have made this a complete project with constant optimizations in progress.

contributors.headline: Engineering Lead | Chief Technical Lead | Passionate about Softwares & Distributed Systems

projects.title: LMA Optimization
projects.description:
Project aimed at optimization of an existing tool used for data analytics. 
Similar to popular online data analysis tools, LastMileAnalytics(LMA) allows users to create and work with data cubes. Different  Visualizations occur in real time. 
Project was aimed at minimizing the data export sizes, making the server-client interaction more secure and making the tool user friendly to operate.

This tool was aimed at shifting the nature of Energy Modelling and populating results thereafter to an Open source environment.

contributors.headline: Engineering Lead | Chief Technical Lead | Passionate about Softwares & Distributed Systems

profile_positions.description:
As an Engineering Lead of the Banking Technology Platform within ING, I act as a bridge between the Enterprise Architects, IT Area Leads, Product Area Lead and Engineers, aligning concepts and designs with implementation. My core responsibilities include: 
1. Contributing to the Engineering excellence within ING- with utmost focus on Non Functional requirements, Maintainability, Performance, Security and Resilience of the software products we create.
2. Proactively identifying and solving technical challenges for the Tribe and ensuring those topics are taken into account for QBR by Product and IT Area Leads.
3. Creating and communicating Software Design Guidelines, with implementations, to the product areas. 
4. Continuously improving the bank's engineering processes with latest trends from the software engineering community to enhance teams' engineering efficiency and productivity.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Lead

profile_positions.description:
Chief Technical Lead of ING Wholesale Banking & Advanced Analytics(WBAA) Tribe, which consists of 6 squads. These products are aimed towards the ING WB FrontOffice users who perform a wide range of tasks: KnowYourCustomer (KYC), Transaction: Sales & Monitoring, Auditing, Sustainable Financing amongst many others. 
We create products with the perfect blend of Engineering, UX/UI & DataScience to solve customer issues faced by the ING Wholesale Bank(WB). 

As Chief Technical Lead, I'm responsible for the Technical Innovation, Development, Architectural Stability, Security & Compliance of the OneClient Domain. I align with various stakeholders, both technical & business, to engage with both users and developers for driving the innovation and development within this domain. In addition, I am also responsible for continuously improving engineering team's processes with latest software & data engineering trends to boost their efficiency.

My ultimate aim is to build effective, performant & robust software systems for solving the foundational problems within the Bank. These problems have been incumbent for decades and need innovative solutions to be completely eliminated.
profile_positions.title: Chief Technical Lead

profile_positions.description:
As a FullStack Software Engineer with Wholesale Banking & Advanced Analytics, I assist in shaping ideas into technical prototypes and then rolling out production-grade applications. We use open-source tools and technologies to deliver data-driven & artificial intelligence based solutions.

I assisted in creation of 2 Financial products, namely, 'Katana' & 'Domino'.

My Backend technical stack consists of: Apache Spark, Kafka, Druid, Flink, AirFlow, PostgreSQL and a few others, in both Streaming and Batch-oriented manner. I have also worked on architecting & creating Distributed Systems using Docker/Kubernetes and Openshift Platform(v4).

FrontEnd: Creation of dynamic web-applications using ReactJS.
profile_positions.title: Full Stack Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Currently working as a Technical Lead for Domino, an application aimed towards ING Wholesale-Banking Front-Desk Employees by enabling them to take smarter & faster decisions on clients with regards to Lending, Mortaging, KYC, Monitoring etc. 

I interface with various stakeholders of the product to gauge & develop requirements for enhancing Domino. From gathering and scoping user-requirements, collaboration with various Chapters, developing features with sound engineering principles to ensuring their timely delivery, I'm involved in multiple stages of the product development process.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Big Data Trainer at Whizlabs.com. 
I authored 2 series there:
a) Apache Spark- The more recent of the two, Whizlabs' Spark course targeted the Spark Developer certification (HDPCD: Spark). The course covered topics on Apache Spark Core and SparkSQL, with applications developed in Pyspark/Scala. This course was prepared from an Operational Point of view- what are the tasks your employer will ask you to complete as a Spark Developer. 

b) Hadoop Administration- Created course to help novices and aspiring Data Platform Specialists to get hands on experience of a Hadoop cluster, its architecture and core concepts. There was special emphasis on Hadoop platform setup, its pre-requisites and Security. 
The course was designed in a way to aid and assist a candidate to excel in the Hortonworks Data Platform Certified Administrator Certification (HDPCA).
profile_positions.title: Big Data Trainer

profile_positions.description:
Offering consultancy in Design and Development of Big Data Systems such as Apache Hadoop, Spark and AWS. Having assisted a few Indian startups, I have experience in setting up the infrastructure and develop applications on Big Data technologies. My core strengths were:
- Apache Spark application development
- AWS: Amazon Redshift, EMR, Amazon EC2 and other AWS components for creation of ETL workflows & DataLakes.
- Automation of workflows using Apache Oozie
- Creation of distributed Systems using Apache Spark and Hive
profile_positions.title: Big Data Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Python Application Developer, responsible for creation of:
1. MIG- Model Instance Generator: Desktop application built to supplement main company software, called VEDA. 
Built as a MonoLith, using Python 2.7 for creation of an ETL pipeline, albeit with HDF5 and MSExcel as the storage layer.

2. Data Mining Projects: Scraping data from websites, applying a schema and persisting in a structured form.

I also automated several manual processes that were done in this firm by creating simple Python Scripts.
profile_positions.title: Python Developer

profile_positions.description:
Assisted BigBasket Analytics, an Indian FMCG E-Commerce firm, to setup and design an OLTP service, involving Amazon RedShift and Amazon PostgresRDS(Remote Database Service). 
- Responsible for creation of data ingestion framework: Daily data size ~1TB: From unstructured data to persisting in a structured manner after applying transformations.
- Creation of ETL workflow to deliver results outside of organisation

The data flow was orchestrated using multi-tenant Bash scripts, running using a multi-threaded execution model.
profile_positions.title: AWS Developer

profile_positions.description:
Certified Hortonworks Hadoop Administrator: Administered clusters comprising of upto 200 nodes, running Ambari Hortonworks HDP2.4. I performed the following tasks as an HDPCA:

a) Cluster Management - Ensuring upkeep and maintainence of Nodes, implementing High Availability, monitoring different YARN Scheduling Queues, configuring mappers/reducers JVM Container Sizes for optimal application performance etc.

b) HDFS Management- Managing and Optimising the logical data repository, creation of roles and user profiles for development, reducing data duplicity and many other production level tasks.

c) ETL Process Automation and Scheduling- Job Scheduling using Oozie for schedling simple ETL processes and Bash/Shell for the complex ones, I automated the entire ETL Processes; from data fetching, its transformation to loading/saving as a reliable data source. 

d) Cluster Security- Implementing Kerberos Security and deploying AccessControlLists(ACL) to keep the data secure from interception by anyone. Data Security is the need of the hour and due to the large volume of data involved in BigData Systems, this task complicates even further.
profile_positions.title: Hadoop Administrator

profile_positions.description:
Created applications for applications revolving around NLP, using: 
a) Apache Spark (v2.1) - using Scala 
b) Apache Hive
c) Apache HBase
d) Apache Sqoop
profile_positions.title: Hadoop Developer
